criteria: Understanding the Causes of World War II
Analyzing the Consequences of World War II
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of the causes of World War II.
Identifies only one major cause of World War II with limited accuracy.
Identifies some major causes of World War II but lacks depth and detail in explanation.
Identifies several major causes of World War II with reasonable accuracy and some supporting details.
Clearly identifies and explains the major causes of World War II, providing relevant details and context.
Provides a comprehensive analysis of the causes of World War II, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of the complex factors involved and their interrelationships.
Demonstrates no understanding of the consequences of World War II.
Identifies only one major consequence of World War II with limited accuracy.
Identifies some major consequences of World War II but lacks depth and detail in explanation.
Identifies several major consequences of World War II with reasonable accuracy and some supporting details.
Clearly identifies and explains the major consequences of World War II, providing relevant details and context.
Provides a comprehensive analysis of the consequences of World War II, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of the long-term impacts and their global significance.
Fails to connect World War II to any broader historical context.
Makes a vague or inaccurate connection between World War II and other historical events.
Identifies a connection between World War II and other historical events, but the explanation lacks clarity.
Explains how World War II fits within the broader context of 20th-century history, providing some relevant connections.
Analyzes the connections between World War II and other historical events, demonstrating an understanding of cause and effect.
Synthesizes a deep understanding of World War II by expertly connecting it to other historical periods, themes, and global trends, highlighting its lasting legacy.
